Package org.jawin

The main Jawin classes.

          Description

Interface Summary
IUnknown A java interface mirroring the COM IUnknown-interface that all COM objects MUST implement.
 

Class Summary
Bootstrap Jawin internal class with native entry points used to bootstrap Jawin.
COMPtr The base class for all COM vtable or dispatch based interfaces.
DispatchPtr  
FuncPtr Class for working with a reference to a single Win32 function exposed in standard DLL's.
GUID  
HRESULT  
IdentityManager  
IEnumVariant TODO: This class NOT TESTED YET!
ReturnFlags Static constants for specifying how error handling should occur in the native code.
UnknownPtr concrete implementation of IUnknown.
Variant The Jawin equivalent of the Windows Variant type.
Variant.ByrefHolder placeholder class for VT_BYREF objects (mostly [out] or [in, out]-parameters).
WinFuncPtr Extend WinFuncPtr to implement a win32 callback function WinFuncPtr is an abstract class instead of interface so that the method can be marked protected

COMError  
 

Package org.jawin Description

The main Jawin classes.

Depending on what you want to do with Jawin, your main interest should be directed on the following classes:

  • Call DLL entry points (exposed functions): Use the FuncPtr-class.
  • Call vtable-based COM objects: You should extend the COMPtr-class.
  • Call IDispatch-based COM objects (also known as scriptable COM objects): You should extend the DispatchPtr-class.

Related Documentation
